channel.title: Comments on: Disable X in Dojo Dialog
channel.description: Don't document the program; program the document.

item.title: By: bitfiddler
item.dc:creator: bitfiddler
item.content:encoded:
Or you could just use dojo.style like this:

var mb = dijit.byId(“dialogID”);
dojo.style(mb.closeButtonNode, “visibility”, “hidden”);

item.title: By: Gaurav Garg
item.dc:creator: Gaurav Garg
item.description: do you know id of x button???
item.content:encoded: do you know id of x button???

item.title: By: Juliana
item.dc:creator: Juliana
item.description: Awesome information. I was having a hard time with this, since although I was able to hide the button from css, the user could still click on it. This fit perfectly.
item.content:encoded: Awesome information. I was having a hard time with this, since although I was able to hide the button from css, the user could still click on it. This fit perfectly.
